column16: What is your annual household income?
column17: What was your overall impression of this event (quality, lighting, sound, value)?
column18: Please share any other suggestions or ideas that would help us enhance your experience at Gesa Power House Theatre. If you would like someone to respond to your feedback, please include your contact information. Thank you!

column17: Outstanding
Very comfortable. We are so glad to have Mike Birbiglia come to the Power House.
It was wonderful to be in an intimate space!  The only complaint I have is with the fog machine. I thought it was unnecessary and felt it made me cough a bit, as well as made my eyes watery.

Sound was great!! Couldn’t understand the smoke effect in the room, and I thought the lighting on Mike could’ve been better. However, overall, it was a great show!!! I was deeply touched at how vulnerable Mike allowed himself to become when telling his Walla Walla story. I feel like I have just, been to some kind of a Sacred service!! Good for him! Both my husband and I feel honored to have witnessed his processing of that story and still made us laugh. A great comedian and storyteller for sure.
Terrific.
column18: I liked the clean comedy.

column17: We had a great time with a very funny Mike Birbiglia! My wife was a little irritated, sinus wise, by the fog machine.
Excellent
column18: Nice to have drinks and snacks too!  This was our first time and we’ll be back! What a great venue

column17: Great venue just a little too much fog from the fog machine.
Perfect!
column18: I have nothing to say to improve anything! As always the staff was lovely, it was organized, the space is beautiful, and Birbiglia was hilarious. Loved it

column17: Loved it.  Laughed for 90 minutes.  I have watched all of his Netflix shows.  One of my favorite comedians.  And his connection to WW, while scarey and sad, makes it special to have him here.  It seemed smokey when we came in, but did not smell smokey.  Sound was fine.  After a week plus of snow, ice and cold tempertures, this show was exactly what was needed.
Amazing
Sat on stage, speakers facing audience. Hard to understand comedian because we were behind the amplifiers. Sometimes garbled in volume levels.
column18: Have a least on speaker facing back to the stage for on stage seats e vents.

column17: Great venue, but it seemed smokey.  Sometimes hard to breath for my husband with asthma.  Overall,  great experience.
column18: Open some doors to get fresh air.

column17: Superb
column18: The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and courteous.

column17: I attended the 9pm show, which was pushed back because of the earlier one running late. I really appreciated the venue staff clearly communicating the delay and making sure everyone knew what was going on. The sound was very clear but if I am totally honest it was at the lower end of audible. There was an obnoxious patron behind me who kept talking and as soon as she opened her mouth I pretty much couldn't hear Mike. I was in row LAA for what it's worth, so off to the side. I'm sure that made a difference.
column18: I would really appreciate venue staff circulating behind rows or along the sides and reminding disruptive audience members to keep it down. I've seen two comedy shows at the Powerhouse and my experience at both of them was negatively affected by other audience members who were clearly drunk and couldn't keep their mouths shut.

column17: Awesome! Ambience, value, performance, Heather coming out to bring tickets to those waiting, ...overall experience was fantastic!
column18:
No need to contact me. But I'm happy to leave my info:
Jason Wicklund
509-301-9203
jhwick@yahoo.com

column17: Mike was fabulous! Staff are always friendly and helpful. Never start on time, why?
column18: Be more forceful about getting people to go to their seats, they block the entrance and never start on time

column17: Love attending events at the power house. Enjoy the smaller theater vibes.
column18: Did not like the fog or whatever was being pumped in? It irritated my eyes, throat, made me (and others) cough, to the point of having to leave the theater, and stuffed up my nose. People with allergies will definitely be sensitive to stuff like that. Maybe it was a request of the performer? But if not, do not recommend doing that again, please!!

column17: Everything was great. The sound in particular was well done. Clear and not too loud. Kept up with the volume changes of the comedian.
Great event
column18: Will call line was blocking people with tickets from getting into the building.

column17: Super great! However, the fog machine was a little heavy. Alos, really wish this event had electronic tickets? Seemed a little chaotic.
column18: Water bottle filling station!

column17: Love it
Very good! Enjoyed the fact that he was funny without vulgar language.
column18: Figure out a parking solution.

column17: Excellent overall.  Sound was top notch, as was the lighting. Mike's story-telling style without use of put-downs, targeted/mean jabs, nor excessive profanity is right up my alley.  My only suggestion is that the fog was a little thick/heavy, particularly at the beginning, for my liking.   Price was an acceptable value for a performer of his caliber.
column18: Thanks for booking such a great artist for our community.

column17: Very nice experience, despite bad weather and the transition from the 6:30 to 9:00 performance. No doubt, the highlight for me was the volunteers. Friendly, helpful, caring and, at the same time, very focused (as a team) on crowd control.  Kudos.
column18: N/A.

column17: Great event with good production values.
Overall, good, but why was the air so “smoky”??
column18: We bought our tickets ages ago - shortly after the e-mail came out. But why weren’t we sent e-tickets?? It was bananas to have so many people queued up for will-call in such a teeny space (and in the freezing rain). And then to give us paper tickets which were collected immediately? Seems wasteful and unnecessary (and slow).

column17: Excellent
column18:
Bring more stand up comedians!
Have a comedian line up once a month for starters. See how it goes.

column17: high quality experience all around! appreciated having the upstairs lounge open for overflow prior to seating.
Very good! Love this venue, the staff, and the performances on your stage!
column18: Love it all!

column17: I am so impressed with absolutely everything you do! The venue speaks for itself, the production value is super high-quality, and the tickets are reasonable. Keep it up!

The ushers were fantastic for the Mike Birbiglia show on Wednesday, January 24, 2024.    We were especially impressed at how a young woman came outside to give us "will call" tickets so as to not cause congestion before the show.  Very smart.  The crowding around the drinks bar created awkwardness.  Coziness was trumped by sluggish crowdedness.
       The lounge where we waited was just ok.  The lighting was good for the show.  The "fog" before the show impeded vision a bit.   Birbiglia himself was wonderful and very personable, and we hope you bring him back.
Fabulous. It was my first time there. It was a great venue. Intimate.
great show, all was good
Very good. No issues.

As usual, the lighting & sound were wonderful.  Much of the value is measured in the experience.  Sometimes, it's worth a little extra money to entice quality entertainment.  If the time spent brings forth something memorable, it's certain to allure people back to the theatre.  After 19 years, Mike Birbiglia returns to cathartically share his tragic incident at the Walla Walla La Quinta.  However, the ultimate outcome results in identifying his sleep disorder and putting him on a more acceptable life track.  Amazing story!
column18: All good.  Despite the event delay, it was carried off rather smoothly.  All volunteers were working very hard to keep attendees content.  Note that good people tend to come to events at the Gesa--no pushing, shoving or unruly types.  A margin of that is due to the friendly, industrious, service-oriented help.  Kudos to all worker bees; that's appreciated!  Wonder if there are any thoughts of bringing food trucks to the events?  I believe that option occurred in the past, but I don't know if it was considered successful or not.

column17: Sound very good and excellent seating!
Great!  Always a fan of PHTWW.
column18: The spotlight operator seemed to have a hard time keeping the spot steady.  MB walks around a lot, but when he was still the light often was not.

column17: It was great! Mike was amazing!
column18: The staff was great! Thank you to all that made this event possible.

column17: Very impressive!
Everything was great! Laughed nearly non-stop.
The entry/lobby is a cluster. How is that setup okay with fire regs? Just ridiculous. The rest of it is great, but the entry is so off putting, every time.
It was a wonderful and intimate event. It will be a treasured memory for years to come.
column18: We would have loved the opportunity to purchase Mike's merchandise, if it had been available in the lobby.

column17: The theater is beautiful and the show was great. As I had anticipated, some of the sound from the seats directly on the side stage could be muffled at times but it did not impede my enjoyment of the show. The lighting was perfect and everyone working and volunteering was so friendly and helpful. I can't wait to come back for another show.

I was very confused about the use of the fog machine for a comedy show. It was foggy outside. Why did it need to be foggy inside?
The lighting, sound, and overall value was excellent. The seating was actually comfortable and I enjoyed sitting in Row B! I appreciated clean bathrooms and friendly employees.
column18: I would have liked a map with more details about parking. I'm always nervous about having my car towed and while Walla Walla isn't a huge city, I was still anxious because I didn't see a lot of signage.

column17: Great! Had an all-around great experience. Staff were very friendly and helpful. And I just want to mention how awesome it was to bring Mike Birbiglia here--amazing evening
Amazing experience!!  THANK YOU FOR THE WONDERFUL THEATRE EXPERIENCE!!
column18: Keep on doing what you do for the volunteers!! They are amazing.

column17: It was awesome all the way around.
column18: Nothing I can think of.

column17: Loved it!
Excellent
Excellent.
From my seat in the J row it was well lit, sound was at the right level, and Mike was absolutely hilarious. Best comeedy show that I have seen in years. Thanks for bringing to W2.
So excellent to see such a talented comedian in such an intimate setting. So looking forward to coming back to Walla Walla to see something else!
Perfect in any way. We came from Spokane and would come again for such a great venue!

column18: A big thank you to Shawna for helping me get a different seat for the 9:00 pm show.  She went above and beyond to help me!

column17: I had a great time. Sound was good and lighting was appropriate
column18: I would appreciate it if the show’s audio could be played in the bathroom. That way I don’t miss a punch line or song due to my bladder

column17: Very good!
Excellent show!
column18: Please invite more great comedians!

column17: we are from portland and came here to see the show in a more intimate venue. so happy we did! really friendly staff, no wait at concessions. super clean and beautiful space. i bought tickets late and had seats in the balcony, right on the end. did not expect them to be great seats. genuinely seems like there's not a bad seat in the place. will recommend to friends, and we'll definitely be back. thank you!
Great performance!  Lighting and sound seemed fine.
column18:
I have noticed this at many concerts, not just the Birbiglia show.  
If there is one thing that could take the Powerhouse from good to great, it would be to allow seating of patrons one hour before show time. After a certain age, adults do not enjoy being mashed together like a techno club mosh pit or a cattle truck.  If lighting and sound checks need to be done before the show, I would humbly suggest that the technicians come in a half hour earlier.  If the performer gets too claustrophobic waiting an hour before the show, then we might consider updating the Green Room.
I have observed patrons becoming angry,  waiting  half an hour for the  doors to open. lve also observed the opposite.  The inevitable outcome of opening the house only 30 min before show time, is that you've trained patrons to arrive at the last minute and then they are being seated after the show  has begun.  This is incredibly distracting for the audience and  perhaps for the performer as  well.

column17: Top notch!  For someone with 5 Netflix specials I thought $55 was very reasonable. Sound and lighting were good- on point, not a distraction
column18: The only negative for me was the seat size .  I’m a large person and AA9 was a tight squeeze.  I was self conscious / embarrassed that I was touching and crowding the people on either side of me.  One of the folding chairs would have been better

column17: Great overall, everything was enjoyable.
Just love the venue, this was our third time over the years, as we come from Clarkston. Love the new potential third floor bar area! We will be back!
It was amazing...loved the volunteers and staff.  So helpful and kind.  The venue is beautiful and we were so thrilled with our seats for Mike Birbiglia...thank you!
Great lighting and sound. Why was it “smoky”? That was very distracting
column18: Fans would have been helpful

column17: Beautiful venue.  Liked the overall look.
column18: My brother needed ADA seats, but it wasn't clear which seats were best when ordering the tickets.  We ordered aisle seats (c1-4) but there was no access from the elevator side of the building but to go through all the seats in the row.  The staff were very helpful in getting used to the seats!  Also, the restrooms were not accessible to him.  We had to rush home.

column17: Everything was great! The lighting and sound was perfect. A little tight standing room while waiting for the show to start, but once started it was fantastic! The staff is very friendly and accommodating, thank you!
column18: If possible to make the waiting area larger before the show starts or allow patrons to go to their seats earlier, that would be a welcome addition!

column17: Great! Intimate.
Great location!  Even though show was running late and we stood in cold for 20 min waiting, staff was very pleasant

We enjoyed every aspect of the show. The comedy was top-notch - we've never laughed so much - yet also thoughtful. The martinelli's we purchased was affordable and tasty, and the sound and lighting were smooth. Thank you for bringing Mike to Walla Walla.
Fabulous. Great venue for a comedy show.

We were very pleased with the intimacy of the venue, the quality of the sound, the lighting. The staff was very friendly and communicative. We drove over 4 hours to see the show (from Boise) and we were very happy with the event.
column18: The temperature control in the venue could have been a bit better (it got quite stuffy in there). Additionally, better signage regarding where to wait would have been helpful. We were there for the 9pm show on Wednesday and the show before ran later than anticipated. Once we were allowed in, it was a bit confusing on where to go. We were not purchasing refreshments/waiting in line and there was not a lot of direction as to where to hang out while the theater was reset or where the theater entrance even was.

column17: We had a wonderful time and Mike was very funny and entertaining.  We were just thrilled that he fit our little town into his tour.  Would love to see him again!

Excellent! We are from Ontario, Oregon. We were very impressed with the quality of the venue. I love when things can be repurposed - including buildings. And, it was a quick walk from the Marcus Whitman, where we were staying.
column18: Great customer service is all about expectations being met or exceeded. We really appreciated your staff coming out and letting us know that the first show had run long and we had time to run to a convenience store to get cough drops and coffee. (I was fighting a cold.)

column17: Great
